sources.title: Golly - Game of Life Simulator
sources.summary: Open-source CA explorer supporting hashlife algorithm (130B cell-gen/sec), multiple topologies, 256-state cells, scriptable via Lua/Python
sources.relevance: Reference implementation for CA exploration tools. Shows what power users expect.

sources.title: MCell - Mirek's Cellebration
sources.summary: Web-based CA explorer mentioned in Wolfram's NKS. Preset rules, gallery approach.
sources.relevance: Web-based precedent. Gallery-focused rather than survey-focused.

sources.title: IndexedDB Best Practices
sources.summary: Use transactions, bulk operations (bulkAdd/bulkPut), batch processing ~1000 items, avoid offset() for pagination, index optimization critical
sources.relevance: Direct guidance for storing 262k rules efficiently

sources.title: Dexie.js Performance Issues
sources.summary: Reading 50k items causes multi-second freezes. Avoid storing table references in objects (causes 10-100x slowdown).

sources.title: Plotly.js
sources.summary: High-level declarative charting, WebGL-backed scattergl trace handles ~1M points with smooth interaction. Built on d3.js and stack.gl.
sources.relevance: Mature option for Atlas visualization, handles scale

sources.title: Scatter-GL (Google PAIR)
sources.summary: Interactive 3D/2D WebGL scatter renderer from TensorFlow Projector. Tens of thousands of points.
sources.relevance: Google's solution for ML embedding visualization. Similar use case.

sources.title: Regl-Scatterplot
sources.summary: Scalable WebGL scatter plot using Regl. Renderer class approach, can share between instances.

sources.title: Deck.gl
sources.summary: Layer-based WebGL visualization. 1M+ points at 60 FPS. Pre-built layers for scatter, heatmap, etc. Uber's framework.
sources.relevance: Very performant, layer approach might be overkill for single scatter plot
